DataElement.preferredName: Patient Ancillary Study Questionnaire Specimen Consent Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable indicator regarding information related to consent obtained from a patient to take part in, and provide research specimens for, a clinical protocol which is secondary to another protocol in which the individual is already enrolled.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Ancillary Study Questionnaire Specimen Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to consent obtained from a patient to take part in, and provide research specimens for, a clinical protocol which is secondary to another protocol in which the individual is already enrolled.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Studies which are secondary to another study.:Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: A study that is secondary to another study.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: I choose to take part in the
ReferenceDocuments.description: I choose to take part in the Behavioral and Health Outcomes (BAHO) substudy.  I agree to fill out the Questionnaires and to have my blood submitted for the specific tests related to the BAHO study.

ReferenceDocuments.name: I choose to take part in the Behavioral and Health Outcomes (BAHO) substudy.  I agree to fill out the Questionnaires related to the BAHO study.
ReferenceDocuments.description: I choose to take part in the Behavioral and Health Outcomes (BAHO) substudy.  I agree to fill out the Questionnaires related to the BAHO study.
